did.abstract: Contains the records of the Division of Finance and Business, which preceded the current Division of Finance and Administration. It was overseen by the Vice President of Finance and Business and was responsible for many administrative functions at the University: budget and accounting, personnel, facilities, security, and internal audit.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Division of Finance and Business was established circa 1977 to oversee a variety of campus departments that had previously operated separately. As of 1992, the departments directly overseen by the Vice President for Finance and Business were: Controller, Human Resources Management, PHysical Facilities, and Financial Management and Budget. The current iteration of this Division is called the Division of Finance and Administration, a name that was adopted in 1998. The Division of Finance and Admininistration oversees a similar range of operations as its predecessor: financial departments and physical facilities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in this collection consists primarily of correspondence, policy and planning documentation, and reports. Topics covered include: Master Plan development; financial support for building construction and renovation; budget planning; development of the Center for Advanced Technology in Thin Film and Coatings; subject files on various aspects of campus facilities and services, including: recycling and waste management, parking, vehicle operations, and custodial services; Resource Allocation Methodoloy planning documentation; materials relating to the administration of the bus service; and documentation of New York State ethics regulations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.
